{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine which branches of the external carotid artery (ECA) supply the nasal septum, we need to refer to the relevant documents. Document [7] states that the blood supply to the nasal septum is provided by the anterior and posterior ethmoid arteries (branches of the ophthalmic artery), the sphenopalatine artery (branch of the external carotid artery), and the septal branch of the superior labial artery (branch of the facial artery). Therefore, the correct answer is C. Facial artery.", "answer_choice": "C"}
